verses.text_plain: And the Lord spake unto Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.verse_html: 1And the Lord spake unto Moses and Aaron, saying,

verses.text_plain: When a man shall have in the skin of his flesh a rising, a scab, or bright spot, and it be in the skin of his flesh like the plague of leprosy; then he shall be brought unto Aaron the priest, or unto one of his sons the priests:
verses.verse_html:
2When a man shall have in the skin of his flesh a rising, a scab, or bright spot, and it be in the skin of his flesh like the plague of leprosy; then he shall be brought unto Aaron the priest, or unto one of his sons the priests: ▼
▼ rising: or, swelling

tokens.text: and it be in the skin

verses.text_plain: And the priest shall look on the plague in the skin of the flesh: and when the hair in the plague is turned white, and the plague in sight be deeper than the skin of his flesh, it is a plague of leprosy: and the priest shall look on him, and pronounce him unclean.
verses.verse_html: 3And the priest shall look on the plague in the skin of the flesh: and when the hair in the plague is turned white, and the plague in sight be deeper than the skin of his flesh, it is a plague of leprosy: and the priest shall look on him, and pronounce him unclean.

tokens.text: on him, and pronounce him unclean

verses.text_plain: If the bright spot be white in the skin of his flesh, and in sight be not deeper than the skin, and the hair thereof be not turned white; then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague seven days:
verses.verse_html: 4If the bright spot be white in the skin of his flesh, and in sight be not deeper than the skin, and the hair thereof be not turned white; then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague seven days:

verses.text_plain: And the priest shall look on him the seventh day: and, behold, if the plague in his sight be at a stay, and the plague spread not in the skin; then the priest shall shut him up seven days more:
verses.verse_html: 5And the priest shall look on him the seventh day: and, behold, if the plague in his sight be at a stay, and the plague spread not in the skin; then the priest shall shut him up seven days more:

verses.text_plain: And the priest shall look on him again the seventh day: and, behold, if the plague be somewhat dark, and the plague spread not in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean: it is but a scab: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.
verses.verse_html: 6And the priest shall look on him again the seventh day: and, behold, if the plague be somewhat dark, and the plague spread not in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean: it is but a scab: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.

verses.text_plain: But if the scab spread much abroad in the skin, after that he hath been seen of the priest for his cleansing, he shall be seen of the priest again:
verses.verse_html: 7But if the scab spread much abroad in the skin, after that he hath been seen of the priest for his cleansing, he shall be seen of the priest again:

verses.text_plain: And if the priest see that, behold, the scab spreadeth in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a leprosy.
verses.verse_html: 8And if the priest see that, behold, the scab spreadeth in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a leprosy.

verses.text_plain: When the plague of leprosy is in a man, then he shall be brought unto the priest;
verses.verse_html: 9When the plague of leprosy is in a man, then he shall be brought unto the priest;

verses.text_plain: And the priest shall see him: and, behold, if the rising be white in the skin, and it have turned the hair white, and there be quick raw flesh in the rising;
verses.verse_html:
10And the priest shall see him: and, behold, if the rising be white in the skin, and it have turned the hair white, and there be quick raw flesh in the rising; ▼
▼ quick…: Heb. the quickening of living flesh

footnotes.body_text: ▼ quick…: Heb. the quickening of living flesh
footnotes.body_html: ▼ quick…: Heb. the quickening of living flesh

verses.text_plain: It is an old leprosy in the skin of his flesh, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean, and shall not shut him up: for he is unclean.
verses.verse_html: 11It is an old leprosy in the skin of his flesh, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean, and shall not shut him up: for he is unclean.

verses.text_plain: And if a leprosy break out abroad in the skin, and the leprosy cover all the skin of him that hath the plague from his head even to his foot, wheresoever the priest looketh;
verses.verse_html: 12And if a leprosy break out abroad in the skin, and the leprosy cover all the skin of him that hath the plague from his head even to his foot, wheresoever the priest looketh;

verses.text_plain: Then the priest shall consider: and, behold, if the leprosy have covered all his flesh, he shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague: it is all turned white: he is clean.
verses.verse_html: 13Then the priest shall consider: and, behold, if the leprosy have covered all his flesh, he shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague: it is all turned white: he is clean.

verses.text_plain: But when raw flesh appeareth in him, he shall be unclean.
verses.verse_html: 14But when raw flesh appeareth in him, he shall be unclean.

tokens.text: in him, he shall be unclean

verses.text_plain: And the priest shall see the raw flesh, and pronounce him to be unclean: for the raw flesh is unclean: it is a leprosy.
verses.verse_html: 15And the priest shall see the raw flesh, and pronounce him to be unclean: for the raw flesh is unclean: it is a leprosy.

tokens.text: and pronounce him to be unclean

verses.text_plain: Or if the raw flesh turn again, and be changed unto white, he shall come unto the priest;
verses.verse_html: 16Or if the raw flesh turn again, and be changed unto white, he shall come unto the priest;

verses.text_plain: And the priest shall see him: and, behold, if the plague be turned into white; then the priest shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague: he is clean.
verses.verse_html: 17And the priest shall see him: and, behold, if the plague be turned into white; then the priest shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague: he is clean.

verses.text_plain: The flesh also, in which, even in the skin thereof, was a boil, and is healed,
verses.verse_html: 18The flesh also, in which, even in the skin thereof, was a boil, and is healed,

verses.text_plain: And in the place of the boil there be a white rising, or a bright spot, white, and somewhat reddish, and it be shewed to the priest;
verses.verse_html: 19And in the place of the boil there be a white rising, or a bright spot, white, and somewhat reddish, and it be shewed to the priest;

verses.text_plain: And if, when the priest seeth it, behold, it be in sight lower than the skin, and the hair thereof be turned white; the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague of leprosy broken out of the boil.
verses.verse_html: 20And if, when the priest seeth it, behold, it be in sight lower than the skin, and the hair thereof be turned white; the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague of leprosy broken out of the boil.

verses.text_plain: But if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white hairs therein, and if it be not lower than the skin, but be somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:
verses.verse_html: 21But if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white hairs therein, and if it be not lower than the skin, but be somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:

verses.text_plain: And if it spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague.
verses.verse_html: 22And if it spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague.

verses.text_plain: But if the bright spot stay in his place, and spread not, it is a burning boil; and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
verses.verse_html: 23But if the bright spot stay in his place, and spread not, it is a burning boil; and the priest shall pronounce him clean.

verses.text_plain: Or if there be any flesh, in the skin whereof there is a hot burning, and the quick flesh that burneth have a white bright spot, somewhat reddish, or white;
verses.verse_html:
24Or if there be any flesh, in the skin whereof there is a hot burning, and the quick flesh that burneth have a white bright spot, somewhat reddish, or white; ▼
▼ a hot…: Heb. a burning of fire

footnotes.body_text: ▼ a hot…: Heb. a burning of fire
footnotes.body_html: ▼ a hot…: Heb. a burning of fire

verses.text_plain: Then the priest shall look upon it: and, behold, if the hair in the bright spot be turned white, and it be in sight deeper than the skin; it is a leprosy broken out of the burning: wherefore the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.
verses.verse_html: 25Then the priest shall look upon it: and, behold, if the hair in the bright spot be turned white, and it be in sight deeper than the skin; it is a leprosy broken out of the burning: wherefore the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.

verses.text_plain: But if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white hair in the bright spot, and it be no lower than the other skin, but be somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:
verses.verse_html: 26But if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white hair in the bright spot, and it be no lower than the other skin, but be somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:

verses.text_plain: And the priest shall look upon him the seventh day: and if it be spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.
verses.verse_html: 27And the priest shall look upon him the seventh day: and if it be spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.

verses.text_plain: And if the bright spot stay in his place, and spread not in the skin, but it be somewhat dark; it is a rising of the burning, and the priest shall pronounce him clean: for it is an inflammation of the burning.
verses.verse_html: 28And if the bright spot stay in his place, and spread not in the skin, but it be somewhat dark; it is a rising of the burning, and the priest shall pronounce him clean: for it is an inflammation of the burning.

verses.text_plain: If a man or woman have a plague upon the head or the beard;
verses.verse_html: 29If a man or woman have a plague upon the head or the beard;

verses.text_plain: Then the priest shall see the plague: and, behold, if it be in sight deeper than the skin; and there be in it a yellow thin hair; then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a dry scall, even a leprosy upon the head or beard.
verses.verse_html: 30Then the priest shall see the plague: and, behold, if it be in sight deeper than the skin; and there be in it a yellow thin hair; then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a dry scall, even a leprosy upon the head or beard.

verses.text_plain: And if the priest look on the plague of the scall, and, behold, it be not in sight deeper than the skin, and that there is no black hair in it; then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague of the scall seven days:
verses.verse_html: 31And if the priest look on the plague of the scall, and, behold, it be not in sight deeper than the skin, and that there is no black hair in it; then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague of the scall seven days:

verses.text_plain: And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the plague: and, behold, if the scall spread not, and there be in it no yellow hair, and the scall be not in sight deeper than the skin;
verses.verse_html: 32And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the plague: and, behold, if the scall spread not, and there be in it no yellow hair, and the scall be not in sight deeper than the skin;

tokens.text: not, and there be in it no yellow

verses.text_plain: He shall be shaven, but the scall shall he not shave; and the priest shall shut up him that hath the scall seven days more:
verses.verse_html: 33He shall be shaven, but the scall shall he not shave; and the priest shall shut up him that hath the scall seven days more:

verses.text_plain: And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the scall: and, behold, if the scall be not spread in the skin, nor be in sight deeper than the skin; then the priest shall pronounce him clean: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.
verses.verse_html: 34And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the scall: and, behold, if the scall be not spread in the skin, nor be in sight deeper than the skin; then the priest shall pronounce him clean: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.

verses.text_plain: But if the scall spread much in the skin after his cleansing;
verses.verse_html: 35But if the scall spread much in the skin after his cleansing;

verses.text_plain: Then the priest shall look on him: and, behold, if the scall be spread in the skin, the priest shall not seek for yellow hair; he is unclean.
verses.verse_html: 36Then the priest shall look on him: and, behold, if the scall be spread in the skin, the priest shall not seek for yellow hair; he is unclean.

tokens.text: on him: and, behold, if the scall

verses.text_plain: But if the scall be in his sight at a stay, and that there is black hair grown up therein; the scall is healed, he is clean: and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
verses.verse_html: 37But if the scall be in his sight at a stay, and that there is black hair grown up therein; the scall is healed, he is clean: and the priest shall pronounce him clean.

verses.text_plain: If a man also or a woman have in the skin of their flesh bright spots, even white bright spots;
verses.verse_html: 38If a man also or a woman have in the skin of their flesh bright spots, even white bright spots;

verses.text_plain: Then the priest shall look: and, behold, if the bright spots in the skin of their flesh be darkish white; it is a freckled spot that groweth in the skin; he is clean.
verses.verse_html: 39Then the priest shall look: and, behold, if the bright spots in the skin of their flesh be darkish white; it is a freckled spot that groweth in the skin; he is clean.

verses.text_plain: And the man whose hair is fallen off his head, he is bald; yet is he clean.
verses.verse_html:
40And the man whose hair is fallen off his head, he is bald; yet is he clean. ▼
▼ hair…: Heb. head is pilled

footnotes.body_html: ▼ hair…: Heb. head is pilled

verses.text_plain: And he that hath his hair fallen off from the part of his head toward his face, he is forehead bald: yet is he clean.
verses.verse_html: 41And he that hath his hair fallen off from the part of his head toward his face, he is forehead bald: yet is he clean.

tokens.text: And he that hath his hair fallen

verses.text_plain: And if there be in the bald head, or bald forehead, a white reddish sore; it is a leprosy sprung up in his bald head, or his bald forehead.
verses.verse_html: 42And if there be in the bald head, or bald forehead, a white reddish sore; it is a leprosy sprung up in his bald head, or his bald forehead.

tokens.text: And if there be in the bald head

verses.text_plain: Then the priest shall look upon it: and, behold, if the rising of the sore be white reddish in his bald head, or in his bald forehead, as the leprosy appeareth in the skin of the flesh;
verses.verse_html: 43Then the priest shall look upon it: and, behold, if the rising of the sore be white reddish in his bald head, or in his bald forehead, as the leprosy appeareth in the skin of the flesh;

verses.text_plain: He is a leprous man, he is unclean: the priest shall pronounce him utterly unclean; his plague is in his head.
verses.verse_html: 44He is a leprous man, he is unclean: the priest shall pronounce him utterly unclean; his plague is in his head.

verses.text_plain: And the leper in whom the plague is, his clothes shall be rent, and his head bare, and he shall put a covering upon his upper lip, and shall cry, Unclean, unclean.
verses.verse_html: 45And the leper in whom the plague is, his clothes shall be rent, and his head bare, and he shall put a covering upon his upper lip, and shall cry, Unclean, unclean.

tokens.text: and he shall put a covering

verses.text_plain: All the days wherein the plague shall be in him he shall be defiled; he is unclean: he shall dwell alone; without the camp shall his habitation be.
verses.verse_html: 46All the days wherein the plague shall be in him he shall be defiled; he is unclean: he shall dwell alone; without the camp shall his habitation be.

tokens.text: in him he shall be defiled

verses.text_plain: The garment also that the plague of leprosy is in, whether it be a woollen garment, or a linen garment;
verses.verse_html: 47The garment also that the plague of leprosy is in, whether it be a woollen garment, or a linen garment;

verses.text_plain: Whether it be in the warp, or woof; of linen, or of woollen; whether in a skin, or in any thing made of skin;
verses.verse_html:
48Whether it be in the warp, or woof; of linen, or of woollen; whether in a skin, or in any thing made of skin; ▼
▼ thing…: Heb. work of

footnotes.body_html: ▼ thing…: Heb. work of

verses.text_plain: And if the plague be greenish or reddish in the garment, or in the skin, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; it is a plague of leprosy, and shall be shewed unto the priest:
verses.verse_html:
49And if the plague be greenish or reddish in the garment, or in the skin, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; it is a plague of leprosy, and shall be shewed unto the priest: ▼
▼ thing: Heb. vessel, or, instrument

footnotes.body_html: ▼ thing: Heb. vessel, or, instrument

verses.text_plain: And the priest shall look upon the plague, and shut up it that hath the plague seven days:
verses.verse_html: 50And the priest shall look upon the plague, and shut up it that hath the plague seven days:

verses.text_plain: And he shall look on the plague on the seventh day: if the plague be spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in a skin, or in any work that is made of skin; the plague is a fretting leprosy; it is unclean.
verses.verse_html: 51And he shall look on the plague on the seventh day: if the plague be spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in a skin, or in any work that is made of skin; the plague is a fretting leprosy; it is unclean.

verses.text_plain: He shall therefore burn that garment, whether warp or woof, in woollen or in linen, or any thing of skin, wherein the plague is: for it is a fretting leprosy; it shall be burnt in the fire.
verses.verse_html: 52He shall therefore burn that garment, whether warp or woof, in woollen or in linen, or any thing of skin, wherein the plague is: for it is a fretting leprosy; it shall be burnt in the fire.

verses.text_plain: And if the priest shall look, and, behold, the plague be not spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin;
verses.verse_html: 53And if the priest shall look, and, behold, the plague be not spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin;

verses.text_plain: Then the priest shall command that they wash the thing wherein the plague is, and he shall shut it up seven days more:
verses.verse_html: 54Then the priest shall command that they wash the thing wherein the plague is, and he shall shut it up seven days more:

verses.text_plain: And the priest shall look on the plague, after that it is washed: and, behold, if the plague have not changed his colour, and the plague be not spread; it is unclean; thou shalt burn it in the fire; it is fret inward, whether it be bare within or without.
verses.verse_html:
55And the priest shall look on the plague, after that it is washed: and, behold, if the plague have not changed his colour, and the plague be not spread; it is unclean; thou shalt burn it in the fire; it is fret inward, whether it be bare within or without. ▼
▼ whether…: Heb. whether it be bald in the head thereof, or in the forehead thereof

footnotes.body_text: ▼ whether…: Heb. whether it be bald in the head thereof, or in the forehead thereof
footnotes.body_html: ▼ whether…: Heb. whether it be bald in the head thereof, or in the forehead thereof

verses.text_plain: And if the priest look, and, behold, the plague be somewhat dark after the washing of it; then he shall rend it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof:
verses.verse_html: 56And if the priest look, and, behold, the plague be somewhat dark after the washing of it; then he shall rend it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof:

tokens.text: of it; then he shall rend

verses.text_plain: And if it appear still in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; it is a spreading plague: thou shalt burn that wherein the plague is with fire.
verses.verse_html: 57And if it appear still in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; it is a spreading plague: thou shalt burn that wherein the plague is with fire.

verses.text_plain: And the garment, either warp, or woof, or whatsoever thing of skin it be, which thou shalt wash, if the plague be departed from them, then it shall be washed the second time, and shall be clean.
verses.verse_html: 58And the garment, either warp, or woof, or whatsoever thing of skin it be, which thou shalt wash, if the plague be departed from them, then it shall be washed the second time, and shall be clean.

tokens.text: from them, then it shall be washed

verses.text_plain: This is the law of the plague of leprosy in a garment of woollen or linen, either in the warp, or woof, or any thing of skins, to pronounce it clean, or to pronounce it unclean.
verses.verse_html: 59This is the law of the plague of leprosy in a garment of woollen or linen, either in the warp, or woof, or any thing of skins, to pronounce it clean, or to pronounce it unclean.
